entry.content:
Social security 'cannot be underestimated' in struggle to escape poverty

Social supports are highlighted as key to realising the benefits of greater employment and enabling social mobility. 

Wednesday, 10 July 2024

Federal Government in the making: King appoints Bart De Wever as 'formator'

Having a formator just a month after the elections is very quick by Belgian standards. But De Wever currently has the backing of coalition partners.

Wednesday, 10 July 2024

Audi announces plans to 'restructure' Brussels production site, 3,000 jobs at risk

Closure of the Forest production site would be a major blow to Brussels' economy and would cost 3,000 jobs. Audi cites a "global decline" in demand for luxury electric vehicles.

Wednesday, 10 July 2024

Golden years: Smallest ever life expectancy gap between men and women

The gap between male and female life expectancy has fallen significantly since comparison began in 1997.

Wednesday, 10 July 2024

Courtrooms go online: Defendants may now attend criminal trials virtually

Belgian courts are on a mission to reduce unprecedented backlogs. The video system allows involved parties to log in to a court session via Microsoft Teams.

Wednesday, 10 July 2024

What's the latest on Belgium's Federal Government formation?

The coalition partners have spent several weeks defining their priorities and red lines. "We are ready to form a new government as quickly as possible."

Wednesday, 10 July 2024

Exposing fraud and serious crime: Belgian authorities increasingly track National Bank register

The register is increasingly seen as a valuable tool to trace tax fraud and money laundering.

Tuesday, 9 July 2024

Where is first class? Belgian rail app now shows train composition

Even before the train arrives at the station, passengers know how many carriages it has and what facilities are onboard.

Tuesday, 9 July 2024

Europe's Ariane 6 rocket ready for lift-off with Belgian technology boost

Belgium is investing in the programme to help Europe gain independent access to space.

Tuesday, 9 July 2024

Code orange in Brussels as afternoon heat is followed by storm and torrential rain

The thunderstorms will see heavy rainfall in a short space of time, hail and locally strong gusts which could cause damage.

Tuesday, 9 July 2024

More tiger mosquito reports in Belgium this year

The tiger mosquito has already been spotted in three separate locations in Belgium during May and June – which is earlier than last year.

Tuesday, 9 July 2024

Brussels libraries to bring children's literature to public parks

"Reading is a method of enriching vocabulary. It’s a potent tool for personal growth and social mobility”

Monday, 8 July 2024

Belgian over 50s know more about climate change than younger generations

Belgians have a good grasp of the causes and consequences of climate change, but know less about possible solutions

Monday, 8 July 2024

Brussels Scout unit organises camp in asylum seeker reception centre

The camp aims to raise awareness for the issues of asylum seekers in Belgium and to engage with the young people of the reception centre.

Monday, 8 July 2024

Belgium's biggest bouldering centre to open in Ghent later this year

"Bouldering is popular – the Ghent climbing halls are always packed, especially since it became an Olympic sport in 2021."

Monday, 8 July 2024

Eviction of occupied building in Ixelles cancelled again

"We will have left the premises by August 4. We hope there will be no further fear of potential eviction, so we can move peacefully."

Monday, 8 July 2024
